title: Madrasa
summary: Madrasa (/məˈdræsə/,[1] also US: /-rɑːs-/,[2][3] UK: /ˈmædrɑːsə/;[4] Arabic: مدرسة [maˈdrasa] (listen), pl. مدارس, madāris) is the Arabic word for any type of educational institution, secular or religious (of any religion), whether for elementary instruction or higher learning. The word is variously transliterated madrasah, medresa, madrassa, madraza, medrese, etc. In countries outside the Arab world, the word usually refers to a specific type of religious school or college for the study of the religion of Islam, though this may not be the only subject studied.
